question.title: Get only explicit parameters for constructor of an inner class
question.body:
The docs on the constructor.getParameterTypes() method says this:

... Note that the constructors of some inner classes may have an implicitly declared parameter in addition to explicitly declared ones.

As it says, I tried to use it for an inner class with a parameterless constructor and it gave me a constructor with one parameter (the enclosing class, an example below). Is there any easy way to only get the explicit parameters?

import java.lang.reflect.*;
import java.util.*;
import java.util.stream.*;

public class TestInner{

    public class Inner{}

    public static void main(String[] args) throws ClassNotFoundException {
        Class<?> innerClass = Class.forName("TestInner$Inner");
        Constructor<?>[] constructors = innerClass.getConstructors();
        String str = Arrays.stream(constructors).map(TestInner::stringifyConstructor).collect(Collectors.joining(", "));
        System.out.println(str);
    }
    public static String stringifyConstructor(Constructor c){
        return "("+Arrays.stream(c.getParameterTypes()).map(e->e.getName()).collect(Collectors.joining(", "))+")";
    }
}

I understand that I can just remove the first element, but how would I know if the first element is 100% implicit? It seems that not all inner classes have this parameter (because the docs say "some inner classes may" and inner classes if I understand correctly mean non-static nested classes). Is there any other factor (besides for not being static) that can cause this parameter to not be there?
